verses.roman:
sa ca māyāṁ samāśritya
daiteyīṁ maya-darśitam
mumuce 'stra-mayaṁ varṣaṁ
kārṣṇau vaihāyaso 'suraḥ

synonyms: saḥ—he, Śambara; ca—and; māyām—magic; samāśritya—resorting to; daiteyīm—demoniac; maya—by Maya Dānava; darśitam—shown; mumuce—he released; astra-mayam—of weapons; varṣam—a rainfall; kārṣṇau—upon the son of Kṛṣṇa; vaihāyasaḥ—standing in the sky; asuraḥ—the demon.
translation: Resorting to the black magic of the Daityas taught to him by Maya Dānava, Śambara suddenly appeared in the sky and released a downpour of weapons upon Kṛṣṇa's son.
